name: adulterate
definition: to debase or make impure by adding inferior materials

name: anomaly
definition: a deviation from the common rule

name: apathy
definition: absence of passion, emotion, or excitement; lack of interest

name: assuage
definition: to make milder or less severe; to appease/soothe

name: capricious
definition: subject to, led by, or indicative of a sudden, odd notion or unpredictable change; erratic

name: enigma
definition: a puzzling or inexplicable occurrence or situation:

name: equivocal
definition: allowing the possibility of several different meanings; of doubtful nature

name: erudite
definition: characterized by great knowledge; learned or scholarly

name: fervid
definition: heated or vehement in spirit, enthusiasm, etc.

name: homogeneous
definition: composed of parts or elements that are all of the same kind

name: laconic
definition: using few words; expressing much in few words; concise

name: loquacious
definition: talking or tending to talk much or freely; talkative; chattering; babbling; garrulous; characterized by excessive talk; wordy:

name: lucid
definition: easily understood; completely intelligible or comprehensible:

name: opaque
definition: not able to be seen through; not easily understood

name: pedant
definition: one who makes a show of knowledge

name: placate
definition: to appease or pacify, especially by concessions or conciliatory gestures

name: pragmatic
definition: of or relating to a practical point of view or practical considerations.

name: precipitate
definition: to cause (something) to happen quickly or suddenly

name: vacillate
definition: to waver in mind or opinion; be indecisive or irresolute

name: zeal
definition: fervor for a person, cause, or object; eager desire or endeavor; enthusiastic diligence; ardor

name: audacious
definition: willingness to take bold risks, showing a lack of respect

name: enervate
definition: to cause something to weaken or feel drained of energy

name: paradox
definition: something that conflicts with its istelf but may be true

name: venerate
definition: to regard with a lot of respect

name: deride
definition: to express contempt for; to ridicule

name: euloguy
definition: a speech that praises someone, usually one who died

name: obdurate
definition: stubbornly refusing to change one's opinion

name: philanhropic
definition: seeking to promote the welfare of others

name: waver
definition: to go back and forth in decision

name: prevaricate
definition: avoid telling the truth by not directly answering a question

name: bucolic
definition: referring to an idyllic rural life

name: agog
definition: very excited or eager with anticipation

name: artless
definition: free from deceit or guile (POSITIVE MEANING)

name: gossamer
definition: something delicate, thin, such as a veil

name: insidious
definition: working in a seemingly harmlessway but actually with grave effect

name: ersatz
definition: substitute product, usually of inferior quality

name: munificent
definition: immensely generous in an unusual way

name: philistine
definition: person lacking in culture or hostile to art

name: soporific
definition: causing or tending to cause sleep

name: inculpate
definition: charge with wrong-doing or to accuse

name: specious
definition: superficially plausible but actually wrong or incorrect

name: hegemony
definition: leadership or dominance over a country

name: innocuous
definition: harmless; not likely to produce any ill effects

name: admonish
definition: to scold or to advise firmly

name: aesthetic
definition: concerned with the nature of beauty and art

name: affectation
definition: fake or artificial behavior, often meant to impress or conceal the truth

name: aggrandize
definition: enlarge or increase, especially with wealth, power, reputation

name: alleviate
definition: to relieve a problem or ease a burden

name: amalgamate
definition: to combine to or mix together

name: ambivalent
definition: having mixed or contradictory feelings about someone or something

name: ameliorate
definition: to improve or mitage a situation

name: anachronism
definition: something old fashioned; something appearing in a time periof where it does not belong

name: anoint
definition: to chose for a particular office or position

name: antithetical
definition: contrary to the very nature of

name: arbitrary
definition: seemingly chosen without reason or purpose
